metadata.title: Three City Guide - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Myoko, Joetsu and Itoigawa are extremely easy to get to and offer a diverse range of attractions and deep cultural experiences.

page_content:
Three City Guide - Myoko Tourism























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenThree City GuideMyoko, Joetsu & Itoigawa three city guide
Connected by road and rail the 3 cities of Myoko, Joetsu and Itoigawa are extremely easy to get to and offer a diverse range of attractions and deep cultural experiences.
Myoko CityMyoko is famous for its rich nature and deep snow. A great place for hiking, mountain climbing and of course winter sports.Joetsu CityA large city, Joetsu is rich is history. A vast number of temples and shrines as well as many other important cultural and historical areas are located in the city. And of course, the famous cherry blossoms that bloom each spring.Itoigawa CityA coastal city that is famous for its fresh and delicious sea food. The area is also an important geological area and features some breath-taking areas of natural beauty.MYOKOMt MyokoTIMESTAMP 0:22 & 2:51Mt Myoko is the dormant volcano that looms over Myoko Kogen. The stunning mountain can be climbed from July through to early November before the snow sets in. The mountain is one of Japans 100 famous mountains. The climb is challenging and rewarding with beautiful panoramic views from the summit.
More InfoJOETSUTAKADA CASTLE SITE PARK CHERRY BLOSSOMSTIMESTAMP 0:38In early April each year over 4,000 cherry trees (Sakura) come to life and bloom their delicate, beautiful pink blooms in Takada Castle Site Park. The nighttime viewing at the park is one of the most famous and spectacular in the whole of Japan.More InfoITOIGAWATakanami-no-Ike Pond TIMESTAMP 0:54One of Itoigawas most stunning areas. This beautiful pond reflects the beautiful surrounds in its clear waters. The area has boat rentals, walking trails and a campground. A beautiful and peaceful area that is also great for photography!More InfoMYOKOKanzuriTIMESTAMP 1:10Kanzuri is a famous special seasoning paste made in Myoko and sold all over the world. The factory and shop can be visited all year round. In winter they lay the peppers on the fresh snow. This draws out the salt and bitterness from them. If you are in the area during winter, you may be able to see this now famous sight.More InfoJOETSUKasugayama ShrineTIMESTAMP 1:20Famous samurai Uesugi Kenshin worshipped at this shrine. You can meet his modern-day version when you visit the shrine and get your photo with him. As well as viewing the historical building and statues you can also walk to the top of Mt Kasuga and get some great views of the city.More InfoITOIGAWABenten-Iwa RockTIMESTAMP 1:41Formed by an underwater volcano this massive sacred rock looms over the coast and has long been worshipped by sailors who saw it as a representation of Ichikushima the goddess of the sea. The small lighthouse on the rock still functions and there is a small shrine on the rock dedicated to the goddess.More InfoITOIGAWACrab MarketTIMESTAMP 1:52Being a coastal city Itoigawa is famous for its fresh seafood. The roadside station is a particularly great place to stop off and try some fresh crab. The shipping boats line up to offload their fresh catch.More InfoMYOKOKimi no ITIMESTAMP 2:01This famous sake brewery has been making high quality sake since 1842. You can visit the brewery all year round. In the video we see them cooking the rice that will be used for making the sake. This is only done 2-3 times a year during the winter.More InfoJOETSUSekai-Kan Movie TheatreTIMESTAMP 2:15This is the oldest still running movie theatre in Japan. A 5min walk from Takada train station, this traditional movie theatre is a great place to watch some classic movies. This beautiful building with its stunning wooden ceiling oozes atmosphere.More InfoJOETSURyotei UkiyoTIMESTAMP 2:24A ryotei is a traditional high-class restaurant that represents the regions food culture. Ryotei Ukiyo is over 140 years old. The rooms in this historical building are beautiful and the history of the building and how it was used is amazing to hear if you can get a tour. The food is delicious & lunch requires no reservation.More InfoITOIGAWAFossa Magna MuseumTIMESTAMP 2:33The Fossa Magna museum tells the story of our planet and the birth of the Japanese islands. The huge collection of mineral and rock samples as well as fossils tells the geological story of the area.More InfoITOIGAWATanimura Art MuseumTIMESTAMP 2:43In summer you can view the beautiful gardens. The art museum is open all year round. One of the last buildings designed by famous brutalist architect Togo Murano the building is as interesting as the sculptures it holds. You may wonder why we didn’t show the sculptures in the video. That is because you are not allowed to capture an image of the heads of the Buddhist statues.More InfoFollow me on FacebookFollow me on XFollow me on LinkedInToursKoya Pond HutGolf CoursesHikingBike RentalPlacesHotelsRestaurantsSnow ReportsSeason PassesSki ResortsSki SchoolsRental ShopsBackcountrySnowshoeCross CountryCAT ToursSnow MobileAccess GuideTrainsLocal BusesWinter BusesAirport ShuttlesTaxisCar RentalNewsletterWe send out a mail magazine 2-3 times a year. metadata.title: Hiking Trails
metadata.description: Information and hiking trails for climbing Mt Myoko and Mt Hiuchi. Detailed guides on the trails for these popular mountains.

page_content:
Hiking Trails























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenMt Myoko & Mt Hiuchi TrailsUpdated onJuly 8, 2024Hiking GuidesOne of Japan’s 100 famous mountains, Mt Hiuchi may be the most stunning mountain you will climb in Japan. Until you start ascending to the summit the climb is not strenuous if you are of moderate fitness. You will hiking through the covered forest and then the open plateau area until you climb the steps up-to the peak of Mt Hiuchi. You can complete this hiking trail in one day. We would recommend you start early around 7AM. If you are reasonably fit you can expect to reach the top in 4.5hrs. Descending will take a lot less. If time allows you should spend the night in the mountain hut or camp ground and then climb to the peak early the next morning. You will need to book the hut if you wish to stay there.
Mt Myoko is an exciting mountain to climb. The hiking trail can also be tough if you don’t properly pace yourself. The course is steep from beginning to end with not many areas allowing you to take it easy. The climb to the summit is the most exciting part of the climb. You will ascend via chains which are hammered into the rocks. Don’t be put off by this as it’s easier than it may sound and the climb is traversed by school children and elderly climbers each year.
You will need to climb via chains and take several narrow paths which have breathtaking views. Once you get to the top don’t just stop at the first peak, you can walk across to the second peak which is more open and is great place to have your lunch and a rest. From the summit you can see the entire region, all the way to the Sea of Japan. On a clear day you can also see Mt Fuji as you climb to the top.
Please note that you can also climb from and return to Akakura Kanko Resort. Please check the map below for the path that heads in that direction.
Mt Myoko and Mt Hiuchi are connected via a hiking trail allowing you to climb both mountains. This is two day climb and you will need to decide if you will stay at Kurosawa hut or Koya Pond hut. In either case you should book the huts in advance. You can also camp at each hut which doesn’t need advance booking. Usually you would stop at Kurosawa hut but if you have a good pace you can also decide to finish at Koya Pond hut on your first day.
Your entrance and exit point will be different but you could also return along the same route on your way down from Mt Hiuchi, back to Tsubame Onsen. In our course below you will start at Tsubame Onsen and exit at Sasagamine. Of course you could do this in reverse. In this case you would most likely stay at Koya pond hut and then descend via Mt Myoko on the second day.

metadata.title: Sasagamine trails - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: There are many trails you can walk in Sasagamine. Here are a few of the popular courses.

page_content:
Sasagamine trails - Myoko Tourism























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenSasagamine trailsUpdated onJuly 9, 2024Hiking GuidesThis trail is very popular in spring when the skunk cabbages bloom in the wetland areas. Yumemidaira which means dream, view and flat land is covered with blooming skunk cabbages with Mt Mitahara in the background. You start this trail from the carpark of the rest house hut and first cross Sasagamine dam and Lake Otomi. After walking across the impressive dam you will climb a steep stairway that is probably the difficult part of this trail. After the stairs you will be in the forest and from here the trail is mostly flat and is suitable for all levels of fitness.
There are some interesting points of interest on this trail besides the main attraction of Yumemidaira. First you will come across Inari Shrine which is a small woodland shrine nestled between large Japanese oak trees. On the return from Yumemidaira you will also pass Shobu Pond which is a small wetland area that is full of skunk cabbages in spring. Zumi tunnel is a narrow path way lined with crab apples that you will need to crouch in order to pass through.
There is also a larger looped course that you can see on the map below. You will need to be careful to turn at the correct point to head to Yumemidaira otherwise you might end up doing the much longer trail.
A great trail for a half day walk that is suitable for all levels. The trail starts from Sasagamine Green House which is also a great place for lunch after you finish. From there you will walk down the road and then through the forest. Sennin Pond is a great scenic spot in spring and autumn. If you visit on a good day the reflections in the pond are amazing.

PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenMadarao Toukyu Golf ClubMyoko Golf CoursesUpdated onJuly 2, 2024Madarao Toukyu Golf ClubIntroductionMadarao Toukyu Golf Club is a large and varied course offering a different challenge at each hole.
Homepage (JP)About Madarao Toukyu Golf Club
Madarao Toukyu Golf Club is literally a game of two halves. The course is split in half offering very different challenges on both sides. On the first 9 holes you will drive up on your cart through thick dense birch forests until you come out on the top of the hill overlooking the resort below and with magnificent views of Mt Myoko directly in front of you. You will need some good accuracy and strategy for these first 9 holes.With each hole you will gradually work your way back down the hillside until you return to the main resort area which is where you play the final 9 holes. These holes are flatter and more open offering a different experience and play style challenge to the first 9.Tangram resort also offers accommodation as well as facilities such as baths and restaurants. They also have a variety of family activities that even young children can enjoy.

PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenMyoko Kogen Golf ClubMyoko Golf CoursesUpdated onJune 24, 2024Myoko Kogen Golf ClubIntroductionMyoko Kogen Golf Club is a highland resort style course located at the foot of Mt Myoko which offers stunning views of both Mt Myoko and Mt Kurohime during play.
Homepage (JP)About Myoko Kogen Golf Club
Myoko Kogen Golf Club is a highland resort style course located at the foot of Mt Myoko which offers stunning views of both Mt Myoko and Mt Kurohime during play. The course has a very different look and style to all the other courses in Myoko. All the holes are framed by dense trees which gives the feeling you are playing through a forest. This is a very popular course amongst golfers and can be busy at times.
It should be noted that Myoko Kogen Golf Club offer online booking in English on their website (the only resort to do so) which makes it very easy and convenient for foreign visitors to play here without relying on their lodge to help assist with booking.
The club house has a restaurant, shop, bathrooms, locker rooms, private rooms and more. You can enjoy lunch with the view of the golf course. There are private rooms for after-competition-partys and meetings.
Myoko Kogen Golf Club practice range has 15 lanes that are 280 yards-long. There is also an approach-practice field and a bunker field for customers to use to improve their golf technique.

metadata.title: Akakura Golf Course
metadata.description: Akakura Golf Course extends from the foot of Mt. Myoko. The course has stunning panoramic views of Mt. Myoko, Mt. Kurohime, and Mt. Madarao from every hole.

page_content:
Akakura Golf Course






















































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenAkakura Golf CourseMyoko Golf CoursesUpdated onJune 24, 2024Akakura Golf CourseIntroductionAkakura Golf Course extends from the foot of Mt. Myoko. The course has stunning panoramic views of Mt. Myoko, Mt. Kurohime, and Mt. Madarao from every hole.
Homepage (JP)About Akakura Golf Course
Akakura course extends from the foot of Mt. Myoko, one of the 100 famous mountains in Japan. The course has stunning panoramic views of Mt. Myoko, Mt. Kurohime, and Mt. Madarao from every hole.
The plateau style course is flows through birch and white oak trees, surrounding you with nature while you play through the dynamically designed course.
The white sand filled bunkers glisten in the sun and are some of the few in Japan. The contrast with the beautifully manicured green grass makes the course not only visually stunning but also helps the bunkers stand out.
Akakura Golf Course uses a 5-seater electromagnetic induction cart. These advanced carts automatically drive themselves through the course, so you don’t need to worry about steering and driving them on your own.
The course changes through the seasons, so you can enjoy the cool breezes of summer or play surrounded by the colourful leaves of autumn. Here is what you can expect though out the year.
・ Golf course opens between late April to early May.・ May: Enjoy the beauty of the remaining snow and fresh greeny on Mt. Myoko.・ June: The turf turns green.・ August: Play in the cool Myoko summer climate.・ From mid-October: Play in the beautiful autumn colors.・ Mid-November: Closed through winter due to snow.
The current course was designed in 1971 by master golf course craftsman Seiichi Inoue who has designed some of the best courses in Japan. At that time 9 holes were added, and the existing 9 holes were remodelled, and the course became the current 18-hole golf course. The design features highly strategic spacious fairways that make the most of nature, trees, ponds, and bunkers that are typical of a plateau style course.
Inoue’s instructions stated that “the natural topography around the green and fairway should be utilized and a modeling method that blends in with the natural environment as much as possible should be adopted.” As a result of this design and method of construction the course feels very natural and part of its surrounding environment.

PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenMyoko Country ClubMyoko Golf CoursesUpdated onJune 24, 2024Myoko Country ClubIntroductionMyoko Country Club is an 18 hole parkland style course situated at an altitude of 700m at the foot of Mt Myoko.
Homepage (JP)About Myoko Country Club
Myoko Country Club is an 18-hole course that opened in 1964 and was designed by Canadian Ernie Brown. The parkland style course is situated at an altitude of 700m at the foot of Mt Myoko which provides a stunning backdrop to every hole on this beautiful course.
The course can be a nice challenge as the fairways gently slope and have fine undulations that make you think about each shot. The greens also feature a tough challenge as they are built around the naturally occurring slope of the area. However, once you learn to read them putting becomes great fun as you use the lines of the green.
The club house has a great restaurant where you can enjoy both breakfast and lunch as well as a variety of drinks. Lunch is included with most rounds.
Myoko Country Club closes from December to mid-April due to the snowfall in winter.

metadata.title: Narita Airport to Myoko by train
metadata.description: Get to Myoko from Narita airports by train. A detailed guide with useful links to help you.

page_content:
Narita Airport to Myoko by train























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenNarita – MyokoUpdated onSeptember 4, 2024TrainsStep OneApprox 1hrTake the NEX Narita Express train from the airport to JR Tokyo StationStep TwoApprox 1.5hrsCatch the Shinkansen from Tokyo Station to NaganoStep ThreeApprox 40minTake the local train from Nagano Station to Myoko Kogen.You want to take the Hokuriku line to Nagano station. The train usually departs from platform 22 or 23 but be sure to check. The journey can take between 1.5hrs and 2hrs. The final train is usually around 10PM.You can buy a reserved seat or a non reserved seat. Tickets are purchased from a ticket machine near the entrance gate to the Shinkansen line. If you cant find the ticket machine please ask a member of staff. The machines are available in English. First you choose your train line, you will need to choose the Hokuriku line. Then you choose Nagano station and select the number of passengers.Your ticket will have your car number and seat number printed on it. You can check the side of the train to see where the respective seating is. Usually non-reserved is toward the back of the train.All cars are non-smoking.Get off the shinkansen and take the escalator up to the main station area. You will need to exit through the gates in order to buy a ticket for the local train. You may need to ask one of the attendants which platform is bound for Myoko. In side the train station there is a tourist office should you need help and advice.Tickets can also be purchased on the train or upon arrival to Myoko station. In this case there is no need to exit the station area. You can follow the sign to the local train platforms and directly board the train for Myoko. Some times you will only have 5-10 minutes to catch the local train. If this is the case you should directly board the local train and purchase your ticket onboard or at Myoko.Download PDF Guide                                         HANEDA   AIRPORT   NARITA   AIRPORT     Tokyo Monorail      Myoko Tourism     www.myokotourism.com                                                                                                                                                                        JR EAST   HOKURIKU SHINKANSEN      JR Yamanote Line     7 min       JR Keihin-Tohoku Line     4 min      Shinano Railway (local train)     Echigo Tokimeki Railway (local train)     45 min     35 min     Keisei Skyliner     JR Narita Express (NEX)      13 - 21min depending on terminal     You can use the Japan Rail Pass       53min depending on terminal     You can use the Japan Rail Pass     Seats must be reserved before boarding      41min depending on terminal     You CAN NOT use the Japan Rail Pass     You CAN NOT use the Japan Rail Pass     You CAN NOT use the Japan Rail Pass     Seats must be reserved before boarding      1.5hrs - 2hrs depending on train     You can use the Japan Rail Pass                       TOKYO   STATION   UENO   STATION             NAGANO   STATION   JOETSU-MYOKO   STATION   Hamamatsucho   Station   MYOKO KOGEN   STATION                    Narita Airport WebsiteFind Bullet Trains TimesBook Bullet TrainsNagano - Tokyo TrainsFollow me on FacebookFollow me on XFollow me on LinkedInToursKoya Pond HutGolf CoursesHikingBike RentalPlacesHotelsRestaurantsSnow ReportsSeason PassesSki ResortsSki SchoolsRental ShopsBackcountrySnowshoeCross CountryCAT ToursSnow MobileAccess GuideTrainsLocal BusesWinter BusesAirport ShuttlesTaxisCar RentalNewsletterWe send out a mail magazine 2-3 times a year. metadata.title: AKAKURA ONSEN SKI RESORT - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Akakura Onsen Ski Resort is a large resort made up of 3 main areas, Yodel, Kumado and Ginrei. There are plenty of different courses suitable for all levels of skier and boarder.

page_content:
AKAKURA ONSEN SKI RESORT - Myoko Tourism






















































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenAKAKURA ONSEN SKI RESORTUpdated onOctober 23, 2024Ski Resorts
Akakura Onsen Ski Resort is a large resort made up of 3 main areas, Yodel, Kumado and Ginrei. There are plenty of different courses suitable for all levels of skier and boarder. It is connected to the neighbouring Akakura Kanko Resort and a joint pass can be purchased. Akakura Onsen is also the only resort in Myoko to offer night time skiing. The night time ski area can be found at the Kumado area on the far end of the resort (see map). The resort has terrain parks, offers back country skiing and has child friendly areas for young children to safely play in.

metadata.title: AKAKURA KANKO RESORT - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Akakura Kanko Resort (also known as ‘Akakan’) was one of the first European-style ski resorts in Japan. The resort was established in 1937 and is one of the most popular resorts in Myoko.

page_content:
AKAKURA KANKO RESORT - Myoko Tourism






















































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenAKAKURA KANKO RESORTUpdated onDecember 10, 2024Ski Resorts
Akakura Kanko Resort (also known as ‘Akakan’) was one of the first European-style ski resorts in Japan. The resort was established in 1937 and is one of the most popular resorts in Myoko. The famous Kanko hotel is situated half way up the mountain on the ski slopes and offers a true ski in ski out experience. The resort is connected with the neighbouring Akakura Onsen ski resort and a joint ticket which allows use of both courses is available for purchase. The resort has slopes that cater to all levels of abilty from beginner to expert.

metadata.title: ALPEN BLICK IKENOTAIRA ONSEN SKI RESORT - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Ikenotaira Onsen Ski Resort is split in to two areas. The central area has a long wide slope. The bottom half of the slope is wide and reasonably gentle. This is a great slope to learn on.

page_content:

 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenALPEN BLICK IKENOTAIRA ONSEN SKI RESORTUpdated onOctober 23, 2024Ski Resorts
Ikenotaira Onsen Ski Resort is split in to two areas. The central area has a long wide slope. The bottom half of the slope is wide and reasonably gentle. This is a great slope to learn on. As the slope is so wide it never feels over crowded. Ikenotaira also has a great snow park (one of the best in Japan), and some truly huge jumps are constructed each year. The left side of the resort (Alpenblick slope) has shorter runs and more ungroomed snow as well as plenty of opportunities to get into the wooded areas and hit untouched snow.

metadata.title: ARAI MOUNTAIN RESORT - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Located in Niigata Prefecture, Lotte Arai Resort in Myoko lies just one hour 46 minutes from Tokyo by Bullet Train and two hours from Niigata Airport. Lotte Arai Resort awaits you amidst a scenic landscape of mountains, stretching outward to the ocean from Mt. Myoko, and a broad expanse of countryside.

page_content:
ARAI MOUNTAIN RESORT - Myoko Tourism






















































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenARAI MOUNTAIN RESORTUpdated onNovember 25, 2024Ski Resorts
Located in Niigata Prefecture, Lotte Arai Resort in Myoko lies just one hour 46 minutes from Tokyo by Bullet Train and two hours from Niigata Airport. Lotte Arai Resort awaits you amidst a scenic landscape of mountains, stretching outward to the ocean from Mt. Myoko, and a broad expanse of countryside.
All 257 rooms at Lotte Arai Resort are open to both long and short-stay guests. On the premises, you will find 14 ski courses and first-class leisure activities, including eight areas of ungroomed snow, spas, pools, restaurants, cafes, function rooms, and a 1501 meter zip tour – the longest in Asia.
The resort’s ski season embodies the excitement of a winter wonderland, while the “green season” offers fresh, clean mountain air and nature in full bloom. Here, you will find year-round fun and relaxation for all. Our goal is to be the premium mountain resort in Asia and we are eager to introduce the world to the beauty of both Mt. Okenashi and the Joetsu region.

metadata.title: MADARAO MOUNTAIN RESORT - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Madarao Mountain Resort sits on the border of Niigata and Nagano prefectures. Half of Madarao Mountain Resort falls with in Iiyama city in Nagano while some of the slopes fall with in Myoko City. Madarao is becoming well known for its ungroomed courses which more advanced skiers and boarders love.

Madarao Mountain Resort sits on the border of Niigata and Nagano prefectures. Half of Madarao Mountain Resort falls with in Iiyama city in Nagano while some of the slopes fall with in Myoko City. Madarao is becoming well known for its ungroomed courses which more advanced skiers and boarders love. Mt Madarao provides amazing views of Mt Myoko and the surrounding mountain range. On a clear day, the view is spectacular. Madarao shares the mountain with neighbouring Tangram Ski Circus and you can purchase a joint ticket which will allow you to ski the whole mountain.
Madarao Mountain Resort offers night skiing on Saturdays and over the New Year.

metadata.title: TANGRAM SKI CIRCUS - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Tangram Ski Circus is a great family resort and is also great for beginners and intermediate skiers and snowboarders. The resort is reasonably small but it neighbours with Madarao resort and a joint ticket can be purchased. This then opens the whole mountain for some amazing skiing and boarding. On clear days, you can get outstanding views of Lake Nojiri and Mt Myoko from the top of the resort.

Tangram Ski Circus is a great family resort and is also great for beginners and intermediate skiers and snowboarders. The resort is reasonably small but it neighbours with Madarao resort and a joint ticket can be purchased. This then opens the whole mountain for some amazing skiing and boarding. On clear days, you can get outstanding views of Lake Nojiri and Mt Myoko from the top of the resort.
The resort is well equipped for children and has a playground and nursery facilities. This makes it amazing for families as parents can leave their children with the nursery staff and everybody can have a great day.
Tangram Ski Circus also offers snowmobiling and snow rafting. Night Skiing is also available on Saturdays.

metadata.title: SEKI ONSEN SKI RESORT - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Seki Onsen is a small ski resort with just 2 lifts that is famous for having some the best snow in the whole of Japan. Seki Onsen is well known for its heavy snowfall and deep powder snow. The resort gets so much snow that it is often open until the beginning of May, long after the other resorts have all closed.

page_content:

Seki Onsen is a small ski resort with just 2 lifts that is famous for having some the best snow in the whole of Japan. Seki Onsen is well known for its heavy snowfall and deep powder snow. The resort gets so much snow that it is often open until the beginning of May, long after the other resorts have all closed. The runs are usually not groomed leaving a lot of powder snow for skiers and boarders to enjoy. While there are some areas suitable for beginners this is usually a resort that more advanced skiers and boarders head to, in order to enjoy some of the world’s best powder snow.

metadata.title: HIKARIGAHARA CAT TOURS
metadata.description: Hikarigahara Cat Tours head to some of the best hidden powder slopes in the area. You will get to experience untouched deep powder.

page_content:
HIKARIGAHARA CAT TOURS























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenHIKARIGAHARA CAT TOURSUpdated onAugust 22, 2024CAT ToursHikarigahara Snow Cat ToursTake a snow cat tour to some of the best hidden powder slopes in the area. You will get to experience untouched deep powder that nobody else has access to. Hikarigahara Cat Tours experienced guides will help you enjoy the best of the backcountry safely. Depending on weather and other conditions you should expect to be able to get in five to seven runs during one tour.
These untracked slopes are about 2,000m with good gradients that make them great for skiing and boarding. Our guides will find the best slopes to suit you, so you have a great experience in the backcountry.
Visit their websiteIMPORTANT NOTEThere is no shuttle to Hikarigahara. You will need to arrange your own transport to the base at Kamisekida. See map.Conditions of Participation
Bring your own transceiver. (If you need to rent from us, rental transceiver will be 3,000yen at the tour base.)
During the tour day, you must obey the instructions of the guide.
The schedule may change depending on the conditions and the weather.
Please note that the number of runs during the tour cannot be guaranteed because the conditions and the weather.

metadata.title: By car to Myoko
metadata.description: How to get to Myoko by car. By using the expressways its very easy to reach Myoko from all major cities.

page_content:
By car to Myoko
























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenBy CarUpdated onJune 19, 2024AccessHow to access Myoko by carEach year more and more foreign visitors access Myoko via car. If you do happen to have your own transport or rent a car getting to Myoko is actually pretty easy. I would recommend using the highways, but bear in mind these are not free. They are all toll roads. If you are using google maps or another navigation tool make sure you turn on use toll roads. The highways are usually not busy once you are out of the major city areas so your journey should be pretty smooth. Make sure you keep an eye out for the correct junction. If you miss your turn you may have to travel 15-20 min before you can come off and turn around.Guide to traveling to Myoko via carFrom TokyoRoute

Tokyo to Nagano: Start your journey on the Kan-Etsu Expressway (E17) towards Niigata. Continue for approximately 140 kilometers until you reach the Fujioka Junction.
Nagano to Myoko Kogen: At the Fujioka Junction, switch to the Joshin-Etsu Expressway (E18) and head towards Nagano. Follow the expressway for about 160 kilometers. Exit at the Myoko-Kogen Interchange and follow the signs to Myoko Kogen.

Tips

Estimated Travel Time: Around 4 hours, depending on traffic and road conditions.
Tolls: Be prepared for toll fees, which can be paid via ETC (Electronic Toll Collection) for quicker passage.
Rest Stops: Utilize service areas along the Kan-Etsu and Joshin-Etsu expressways for breaks and refreshments.

From NagoyaRoute

Nagoya to Nagano: Depart from Nagoya on the Chuo Expressway (E20) heading towards Matsumoto. Continue on this route for approximately 230 kilometers until you reach the Okaya Junction.
Nagano to Myoko Kogen: At the Okaya Junction, merge onto the Nagano Expressway (E19) and proceed towards Nagano for about 60 kilometers. Transition to the Joshin-Etsu Expressway (E18) at Nagano and drive towards Myoko. Exit at the Myoko-Kogen Interchange and follow the signs to Myoko Kogen.

Tips

Estimated Travel Time: Approximately 5 hours, varying with traffic conditions.
Tolls: Ensure you have cash or an ETC card for toll payments along the Chuo and Nagano expressways.
Scenic Routes: Enjoy the picturesque landscapes along the Chuo Expressway, especially around the Kiso Valley and the Japanese Alps.

From OsakaRoute

Osaka to Nagoya: Begin your drive on the Meishin Expressway (E1) heading east towards Nagoya. Travel for roughly 170 kilometers until you reach the Komaki Junction.
Nagoya to Nagano: From the Komaki Junction, transition to the Chuo Expressway (E20) and follow the same route as described from Nagoya, continuing to Nagano.
Nagano to Myoko Kogen: Merge onto the Nagano Expressway (E19) at Okaya Junction, then onto the Joshin-Etsu Expressway (E18) towards Myoko. Exit at the Myoko-Kogen Interchange and follow the signs to Myoko Kogen.

Tips

Estimated Travel Time: Around 6-7 hours, depending on traffic and driving speed.
Tolls: Prepare for multiple tolls along the Meishin, Chuo, and Nagano expressways. ETC cards are recommended for convenience.
Rest Stops: Take advantage of service areas such as the Lake Biwa Service Area for breaks and to enjoy local specialties.

metadata.title: Ski Schools - Myoko Tourism
metadata.description: Book a lesson for adults and children of all levels at one of Myokos many ski schools. Take a lesson from a highly qualified professional instructor.

page_content:
Ski Schools - Myoko Tourism























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenSki SchoolsUpdated onAugust 30, 2024WinterMyoko SnowsportsMyoko Snowsports are the biggest snowsports school in the Myoko area. They are also the official ski school for Lotte Arai Resort. Myoko Snowsports offer a wide range of courses for both adults and children and cater to all levels of ability from beginner to expert. Experience the best of Myoko’s skiing and snowboarding with one of their resident professional instructors. You will build your confidence and progress your skills while being guided around the wealth of terrain Myoko has to explore. Choose from group and private program options.Website Yodel Snow SchoolYodel snow school was established in 1960 and is the oldest snow school in Myoko. They offer professional snowboard and ski training as well as back-country and snow-shoe courses. Yodel snow school have lessons for both adults and children and for all levels of ability. If you want to get off the ski runs try out their guided off-piste tours or snow-shoeing tour. If you want to push yourself try out their race training or take an international ski test to see how good you are.Website Canyons MyokoCanyons Myoko strive to provide the best snow experiences in Japan. Their international crew of professional instructors will ensure you a fantastic Myoko experience, whether you are a first timer or a seasoned veteran. Offering exclusively private lessons, the undivided attention of our highly qualified instructors means that you truly get the most out of your time in Myoko with lessons tailor-made for you. Morning, afternoon, and full-day lessons are available.

All our prices include up to 6 guests per lesson.WebsiteEscape Myoko Ski SchoolExperience the best Myoko has to offer with Escape Myoko! Whether you're a beginner or an advanced rider, our certified instructors provide personalized coaching to help you build confidence and master new techniques on the slopes. We offer private lessons tailored to your needs and preferences. For those interested in pursuing a career in snow sports, we also provide NZSIA-certified ski and snowboard instructor courses. Additionally, our resort guiding services are perfect for first-time visitors looking to explore the best runs and hidden powder stashes. Book your lesson today and experience the very best that Myoko has to offer!Website Japan SnowsportsJapan Snowsports is an international snow school based in Madarao.  They are a group of highly qualified instructors with many years of experience. page_content:
Rental Equipment























































 Skip to main content
Skip to footer
PlacesStayEatActivitiesWinterAccessNewsContactOnsenRental EquipmentUpdated onJuly 9, 2024WinterMyoko SnowsportsMyoko Snowsports will have everything you could possibly need. They have a huge selection of skis, snowboards and ski wear for both young children and adults. They also stock large sized boots which are usually difficult to find in Japan. Their staff are all native English speakers and can give you expert advice on what equipment is best for you. They have skis and snowboards for all types of use, from on-piste beginners to freestyle and powder skis and snowboards.WebsiteAoyama SportsAoyama have 3 stores in the Akakura Onsen area. They have an online reservation system so you can book your equipment in advance. You can also receive a discount by doing this. They have equipment for all levels and stock brand name skis and boards from Burton, K2, Zuma and many more. They also offer an overnight waxing service for your skis and snowboard.WebsiteGo Myoko RentalsGo Myoko Rentals is situated in the heart of Myoko with our shop at Hotel Taiko in Akakura Onsen. Offering high quality rental equipment, you can find everything you need for your snow adventures at Go Myoko Rentals. Rental costs start from 3,000yen for a half day and 4,000yen for a full day and from as little as 2,000yen for kids.WebsiteLotte Arai ResortWe offer ski and snowboard gear rental.
In addition to carrying all sizes, from child to adult, as well as a variety of colors and designs from Salomon, we also carry high end designs from a variety of brands. We want you to hit the slopes using the gear that suits you the best.
Salomon Station at LOTTE ARAI RESORT is a member of the network of “S-B-B certified technicians” recommended by the Association of Japan Ski Promotion. WebsitePowder ReconPowder Recons skis and boards are available for hire, at a competitive rate. They are working together with Nordica skis to fully equip their rental store with the newest and best all mountain and powder skis on the market. Powder Recon is also working with Japanese powder snowboard makers, Green Lab and Japanese ski goggle brand, SWANS – designed to give you the very best visibility on the mountain. Their experienced ski techs will assist you with all your rental gear, making sure you get the best equipment for your ability. Reservations for the 2025 tour are now being accepted.
 
We are very excited to announce the launch of one of the biggest snowmobile tour operations in Japan!
YUKISATO Snowmobile Tours accommodates for riders of all abilities and experience, offering everyone the chance to explore the amazing Joetsu Myoko Area.
Our tours are like no others - bigger terrain, longer riding time, and breathtaking views!
 
 











 《  Tour overview 》 










<tc>YUKISATO SNOWMOBILE TOURS</tc>Wilderness adventure

This tour is suited for first time riders and intermediate riders alike who want to discover snowmobiling in Japan. Friendly Guides will provide you with an unforgettable snowmobiling experience through the Okazawa forest no matter what your level.
 
Tour time: 9:00 / 11:00 / 13:00Duration: 1.5 hours ( excluding pick-up time )  Price: ¥24,000～
 

<tc>Wilderness Adventure Details</tc>



















<tc>YUKISATO SNOWMOBILE TOURS</tc><tc>YUKISATO Experience</tc>

This is a great tour for those wanting to experience more of the beautiful Okazawa area. We will take you further up into the forest where a snowshoeing or Yukiita experience can be enjoyed to take in the amazing scenery. Local beverages and snacks will also be provided.
Tour time: 9:00 / 13:00Duration: 2 hours ( excluding pick-up time )Price: ¥35,000～

Powered by Shopify

﻿Greengreen Guesthouse




Welcome to Greengreen Guesthouse! This property was purchased as an akia (abandoned house) in 2019 and restored with the aim of bringing back to life the original ambience of this 70’s era Japanese snow-country home. 


The guesthouse has two floors and a basement.  Each floor has its own kitchen, bathroom, toilet and living area, and each can function as a self-contained two bedroom apartment sleeping up to 4 people.  


The basement has a communal dry room and Ski/Snowboard/Equipment storage area. The basement can also be used for Ski Tuning.


Greengreen Guesthouse  is located in the village of Suginosawa, at the base of Mt Myoko and Suginohara Ski Resort.  Guests can access Suginohara Ski Resort via the Suginohara Romance Chair which is 200 meters from the guesthouse.


Please enjoy your stay at Greengreen Guesthouse!






Contact Information 
Hosts:         Maki and Michael  
Email:         greengreenguesthouse@gmail.com 
Mobile:         81 90 7210 2046  
WhatsApp:         81 80 2569 3415 
Instagram:         @greengreenguesthouse 
Address:         1836-1 Suginosawa
                Myoko, Niigata
                949-2113


Emergency Numbers
Fire/Ambulance:         119
Police:                110


________________


Guesthouse Information


Wifi
Name: GlocalNet OUVM7G
Password: 08570595


Heating
Gas heaters are provided in all rooms. Please make an effort to keep warm while minimizing heater use by observing the following:
* Put more clothes on!
* Keep doors closed.
* Gas heats rooms very quickly so there is no need to leave heaters on in empty rooms.
* Operate heaters on the lowest temperature setting.  Heaters will function continuously at a gentle pace and keep the room at a comfortable temperature.
* Hot water bottles are available.  These are great for warming the bed before you go to sleep and will continue  providing heat throughout the night.
* Quality doonas and blankets are provided. You should be able to have a warm and comfortable sleep without leaving the heaters on overnight.
* Please ensure all heaters are turned off whenever you leave the house.




Rubbish
Please divide rubbish into the following 3 groups:
1. Burnable: All paper, plastics and anything dirty
2. Recycle: Cans and bottles (Glass or plastic) cleaned, dried and labels removed.
3. Compost: Raw fruit and vegetable scraps only please


Please put full rubbish bags under the steps in the basement.


Dry Room
There is a dry room available in the basement which operates on a timer system.


Equipment Storage
Ski/snowboard rack locations:
1. Outside, below the entrance.
2. Immediately inside the entrance.
3. In the basement (dry skis and snowboards only please)


Feel free to use the basement area for storage of ski/snowboard bags and equipment.


Ski/Snowboard Tuning
Dane across the road offers an equipment tuning service. You can contact him via mobile or WhatsApp on 61467628666.


Feel free to use the basement for ski and snowboard maintenance.  A workbench and clamps are available, as well as a dustpan and broom for cleaning up any mess😉.




Snow Clearing
We will endeavor to keep access to and from the guesthouse clear of snow, however snow will often accumulate very quickly during a typical winter storm in Myoko! Feel free to join in on the snow clearing fun, grab the nearest shovel and clean the steps whenever you like ❄️😄!












Suginosawa
The local village is named for the Japanese cedar trees (Sugi)  which dominate the surrounding hills, and the gully (sawa) which channels mountain water through the lower part of town.  Suginosawa is a traditional farming village which has existed for much longer than the adjoining Suginohara Ski Resort.  The village is surrounded by rice paddies and produces some of Japan’s (aka the worlds) best rice.  


Village Facilities
* Onsen
* Two Pines Pizza Restaurant 
* Ski/Snowboard rental - available at Two Pines Pizza
* The Den Bar and Restaurant - delivery available via QR code 
* Shuttle bus service to/from Myoko Resorts 
* Local bus service 
* Convenience Store (basic supplies only) 
* Post office with ATM (international cards accepted) 


All village facilities are within easy walking distance from Greengreen Guesthouse. 


________________


Public Transport
For access to Ikenotaira, Akakura Kanko and Akakura Onsen Ski Resorts, take the Mt Myoko Shuttle from the carpark in front of the fire station (on the main street diagonally opposite the onsen). Cost is ¥1,000 each way.


Mt Myoko Shuttle Timetable


  

A local bus service operates between Suginosawa and Myoko Kogen.  The closest bus stop is located on the main street in front of the onsen.


Local bus timetable
